reviewText: I am a big fan of Leahy and was glad to see them come out with a DVD.  The Live Concert is pretty good, but I think it could have been better.  The sound mixing could have been better, for example I thought many times I couldn't hear some of the other instruments (especially the piano) even though you could see they were being played.  Plus, I don't know why there are 5 songs found in one of the bonus sections that were part of the concert.  Why were they just not included in the live concert?The best part of the DVD is the Leahy Special Features.  In this section you get the Leahy story so to speak and other interviews.  The greatest, however, is that this section contains some of Leahy's earlier music videos, such as B Minor, Mission, The Call to Dance and Chasing Rain (this one is really good).  I think these are better than their live concert and it definitely makes it worth it to have this DVD because of these music videos.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've adored Leahy since I stumbled across their first CD, several years ago. AFAIK, this is their first DVD, and I sincerely hope it's the first of many. The DVD presents their first broadcast show for PBS. This family puts on a wonderful show, and the music they make is beyond outstanding. They combine traditional Cape Breton and Irish/Scottish fiddling syles with updated instrumental accompaniment in a way that injects modern vitality into already wonderful traditional musical styles. And Donelle Leahy, their lead fiddler, can't really be quite human! Don't neglect to watch the "additional performances" section of the DVD--it was a crime to cut *any* part of this production from the broadcast.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I played this DVD the other night for a friend who is not into Celtic Music. He was back the next night wanting to see it again. Yes, it is that good. What really impresses me about the Leahy family is that they are a wholesome bunch of people yet covey such a cool and hip attitude. I really do not know what their religious affiliation is but their music quietly demonstrates a deep faith in God that is such a refreshing change from the many in your face type Christian groups. I am not much on watching televised concerts, but this one makes you feel part of it even sitting in your living room. The videos included as extras make this a must buy. Highly, highly recommended.
